question: Who has been appointed Britain's first Indian-origin home secretary?
explanation: Priti Patel, a prominent member of the Back Boris campaign for the Conservative Party leadership, has become the Britain\'s first Indian-origin home secretary as part of new Prime Minister Boris Johnsonâ€™s top team. She succeeded Pakistani-origin Sajid Javid, who moves to the Treasury department as the first ethnic minority Chancellor of the Exchequer. Mr Javid, a former banker from a modest background, was a contender for the premiership but endorsed Johnson when he failed to get enough support from fellow Conservative MPs. Mr Johnson has also named Brexit hardliner Dominic Raab as the country\'s Foreign Secretary.
